definition: to walk (side part of split character)
to make a circuit/to circle/circle/circumference/lap/cycle/complete/all/all over/thorough/to help financially
see 眾所周知|众所周知[zhong4 suo3 zhou1 zhi1]
Golden Week, two 7-day national holiday periods

sentences.english: Illustrates step on the Old City, an area said Chau, Some weeks back to full.
sentences.chinese: 上有步闡故城，方圓稱洲，週迴略滿。

sentences.english: The process never ends; it constantly moves back upon itself to go forward.
sentences.chinese: 這過程永無止盡，總是週而復始的繼續向前。

sentences.english: It follows this loop over and over again until it is turned off.
sentences.chinese: 它週而復始地執行這些循環，直到被關閉爲止。

sentences.english: There are repeated scares and usually it's all right.
sentences.chinese: 經濟危機週而復始但最後總是會結束。

sentences.english: Only the cycle of changes could display spectacular scene.
sentences.chinese: 只有週而復始的變動纔會煥發出萬千的氣象。

sentences.english: It was my start to the day, every day.
sentences.chinese: 這是我一天的開始，週而復始。

sentences.english: Hoeppli phenomenon was observed around the egg at the fifth week.
sentences.chinese: 第五週開始可見卵周有何博禮現象。

sentences.english: This porcelain version was unveiled at Milan Design Week 2010.
sentences.chinese: 這個瓷制鹿頭噴頭在2010米蘭設計週上面世。

sentences.english: Objective To explore the application effect of two types of catheters in peripherally inserted central catheter (PICC).
sentences.chinese: 目的探討兩種導管在外週中心靜脈置管中應用的效果。

sentences.english: They have gathered in Rome for the first Green Standards Week conference.
sentences.chinese: 他們齊聚羅馬參加第一屆綠色標準週會議。

sentences.english: Objective To report a case of perivascular epithelioid cell tumor(PEComa) of the liver, and improve the understanding of the tumor.
sentences.chinese: 目的分析肝臟血管週上皮樣細胞瘤的臨牀特點。

sentences.english: But there is no choice but to go on.
sentences.chinese: 但除了週而復始，就別無選擇。

sentences.english: Labile cells follow the cell cycle from one mitosis to the next.
sentences.chinese: 不穩定細胞循細胞週期週而復始地進行有絲分裂。

definition: wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
to arrive at (place or time)/period/to become due/classifier for events, meetings, elections, sporting fixtures, years (of graduation)
disposition of troops/wave/spate/burst/spell/short period of time/classifier for events or states of short duration
to lose/to transport/to donate/to enter (a password)
